name: ios7
title: Evasion
description: The default wallpaper of the devices I jailbroke as a kid.

name: wonder
title: Wonders
description: The default wallpaper of my first smartphone, the Samsung Galaxy W, on which I installed countless custom ROMs.

name: win8
title: Backupless
description: The default wallpaper of my first successful OS install on a computer... How could I have known there was important data on the family computer?

name: holo
title: Holo-graphic
description: The default wallpaper of my first custom OS install I did on my phone when I was ten.

name: cid
title: Warranty Voider
description: If I had a cent for every CyanogenMod version I installed on a phone...

name: win10tp
title: Not For Public Release
description: I tried installing Windows 10 a few months before its launch. Wait, what did you say about "backups"?

name: ubuntu
title: Trusty Tahr
description: I had first installed it for building an Android ROM until I realized I had installed the 32-bit version while our computer actually supported x64... (that still didn't solve the problem)

name: s5
title: TouchWiz
description: Wallpaper from the Galaxy Star 2 Plus (and the Galaxy S5), the first phone I bought with my own money, and on which I ported a custom ROM for the first time ever when I was 12!

name: sierra
title: Sierra Leone
description: My first Hackintosh install's default wallpaper! The hours of troubleshooting were worth it.

name: longhorn
title: Hasta la Vista
description: In 2018, I took interest in beta versions of Windows, particularly Longhorn (which eventually became Vista). The story behind it is very interesting in case you want to look it up.
